channel.title: Need help with client
channel.description:
How do i change a client to connect to my ip not my friends? My friend made a client, he gave it to me and i dont know how to change it. Can someone help me?
P.S My friend is in Italy now so he can't tell me..

item.title: Need help with client
item.dc:creator: @aimx1 aimx1
item.description:
@aimx1 wrote:

wait ill try it[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 16, 2008, 05:18:38 AM[/size][hr]THANKS SIMON!!! Thank you very much!! Found it =]

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with client
item.dc:creator: @Simonrofl Simonrofl
item.description:
@Simonrofl wrote:

public final Socket method19(int i)
throws IOException
{
return new Socket(InetAddress.getByName(“127.0.0.1”), i); //client IP
}

Search the public final socket in client.java and change the ip there to yours.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with client
item.dc:creator: @leder678 leder678
item.description:
@leder678 wrote:

[quote=“leder678, post:8, topic:189899”]Normally when it connects to his ip, the ip is:
127.0.0.1, because that is “local server”
so then it connects to himself and not your IP.
Else it is HIS ip, and then you have to ask him for it.

open you client.java (client side)
and search for this:

setserver("

and

server = "

And edit what that is between two "'s

and then open EGUI.java, and you will see something like this:

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“127.0.0.1”, “127.0.0.1”, “127.0.0.1”
});
}
}
[/code]

Just edit the 127.0.0.1 to your IP, the 127.0.0.1 is what my client shows, but might be different on yours[/quote]

BUMP, try this, it is my own

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with client
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

He just said, it doesnt find it. But yeah, it wouldnt be localhost IP, otherwise he’d have no problem connecting, because it would just connect to his IP.

So really, other than finding out the IP, or searching through the code, your not going to find it.

But, searching “IP” should find it, yes it will come up with a lot of words not related, but if you keep searching… It should come up.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with client
item.dc:creator: @leder678 leder678
item.description:
@leder678 wrote:

Normally when it connects to his ip, the ip is:
127.0.0.1, because that is “local server”
so then it connects to himself and not your IP.
Else it is HIS ip, and then you have to ask him for it.

open you client.java (client side)
and search for this:

setserver("

and

server = "

And edit what that is between two "'s

and then open EGUI.java, and you will see something like this:

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“127.0.0.1”, “127.0.0.1”, “127.0.0.1”
});
}
}
[/code]

Just edit the 127.0.0.1 to your IP, the 127.0.0.1 is what my client shows, but might be different on yours

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with client
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Then you wont be able to change it without searching through a LOT of codes, which could take some time. But thats what your going to have to do unless you can get in contact with him.

EDIT: Im not great with clients, but im sure if you search for something that would be before the IP (idk what it would be, as i said im not great with clients) But for example, if in a server you was searching for what a command does, you’d search for the name of the command or the message it sends you, something closely related to what your looking for.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with client
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Ctrl + F

Search: His IP.

Change that to yours. Done.
